intro: Sida brachyantha, commonly known as the smallleaf cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features small, pale green leaves and produces fluffy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Sida brachyantha is an annual herb that is adapted to arid environments and has a low water requirement.
